gloss.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a bright shine on a surface
gloss.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: This gel will add gloss to even the dullest hair.
The silverware had been polished to a high gloss.
gloss.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an attractive appearance on the surface of something that may hide something less pleasant
gloss.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Beneath the gloss of success was a tragic private life.
The injury to Keane took the gloss off Manchester United’s victory.
gloss.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a note in a piece of writing that explains a difficult word, phrase, or idea
gloss.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a description or explanation that makes something seem more attractive or acceptable than it really is
gloss.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The minister was accused of putting a gloss on the government’s poor performance.
gloss.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: paint that looks shiny after it dries
gloss.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to provide a note in a piece of writing, explaining a difficult word, phrase, or idea
